original_title: No restrictions in foreign employment for mothers: Sri Lanka labor ministry
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Minister of labor and foreign employment Manusha Nanayakkara said he rejected the recommendation for reinstating the ban on mothers with children under 5-years working abroad.
“Parental responsibility belongs to both the mother and the father,” Nanayakkara told EconomyNext. “Why should this apply to mothers and not to fathers?”
The recommendation to reinstate the ban on mothers of young children from foreign employment was made by the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Children, Women and Gender Relations.
Researchers from the Advocata Institute had previously pointed out that women are kept out of the workplace due to unpaid care work.
According to World Bank data, women’s labor force participation in Sri Lanka is 33.1 per cent in 2022 while the employment rate for men is 70.7 per cent. (Colombo/Jan2/2024)
